content.text:
# New Features

ElizaOS has added several significant features in recent pull requests:

- Added support for NVIDIA inference (#2512)
- Implemented a client-agnostic Devin plugin (#2549)
- Added Anthropic image provider for vision capabilities (#2524)
- Integrated OpenAI for text generation (#2463)
- Added Lightning plugin support (#2429)
- Created functionality to create/store/restore agents in the filesystem (#2389)
- Added more actions to the Abstract Plugin (#2531)
- Added Rabbi Trader tests (#2520)
- Updated the blockchain sector diagram to include 0G (#2204)

# Documentation Improvements

The project has expanded its documentation:

- Added ElizaOS technical report/paper (#2517)
- Added Japanese README documentation (#2515)
- Updated documentation for user ID with room ID in MemoryManager (#2492)
- Updated README with prerequisites for enabling Telegram bot (#2547)

# Bug Fixes and Optimizations

- Fixed CoinGecko headerKey usage from API config (#2518)
- Fixed build/start failures in the develop branch (#2545, #2546)
- Enhanced TTS generation flow and caching (#2506)
- Added default Coinbase AgentKit plugin (#2505)
- Optimized PNPM cache configuration, later reverted (#2555, #2556)

# Testing Improvements

- Added plugin-tee tests and adjusted project structure (#2508)
- Implemented API timeout handling tests for plugin-binance (#2504)
- Added test configuration and tests for client-lens (#2534)

# CI/CD Changes

- Removed cleanup step from integration tests workflow (#2551, #2553)

categories.title: Recent Twitter Activity from dankvr and shawmakesmagic

content.text: dankvr shared optimization tips for documentation aimed at LLMs, including embracing page structure, segmenting by sub-products, including FAQs, providing self-contained code snippets, and writing text descriptions for images.
dankvr mentioned that @0xMert_ coded something and shared an image related to it.
dankvr responded to @baoskee with 'pretty much same here' and included an image.

shawmakesmagic made several comments about cryptocurrency, including references to Vitalik Buterin and a joke about the US President launching a 'shitcoin.' They also suggested Elon Musk release a memecoin to 'save America.'
shawmakesmagic shared two images with the captions 'What a time to be alive' and 'Patriots'.
shawmakesmagic responded to several users with brief comments, including jokes and appreciation.

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository, covering various components and functionalities:

1. Agent-related issues:
   - Issue #2530: Problems with starting @elizaos/agent using the command `node --loader ts-node/esm src/index.ts "--isRoot" "--characters=characters/eternalai.character.json"`
   - Issue #2521: Agent not replying to new target users' tweets, incorrectly claiming it has already responded

2. Client and connection issues:
   - Issue #2540: Chat client experiencing unstable connections with ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT errors, though port 3000 works fine, and agent list not displaying
   - Issue #2557: Telegram client not working or responding

3. Integration and configuration:
   - Issue #2522: Request for Virtuals Terminal API integration
   - Issue #2565: Request for integrating searxng
   - Issue #2533: Need for test configuration and test suite for client-lens

4. Installation and error issues:
   - Issue #2513: Problems with installing @elizaos/plugin-0g
   - Issue #2569: Incorrect OpenAI error on clean start when OpenAI key is not used
   - Issue #2578: Generic fix error request

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several new pull requests focused on adding new features and improving existing functionality. Notable PRs include:

- Templates implementation (PR #2535)
- OpenAI integration for text generation (PR #2463)
- New plugin integrations including Devin, Truth Social, and CoinGecko
- Additional actions for the Abstract Plugin (PR #2531)
- Test configuration for client-lens (PR #2534)
- Package.json fix for multiple React versions (PR #2574)

These contributions demonstrate ongoing development to enhance the platform's capabilities through new integrations, improved templates, and better plugin support.

The elizaos/eliza repository has shown increased activity over a two-day period. From January 19-20, 2025, there were 15 new pull requests (with 12 merged), 6 new issues, and 33 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (January 20-21, 2025) with 31 new pull requests (13 merged), 11 new issues, and 50 active contributors. This represents significant growth in community participation, with a 51% increase in active contributors and more than double the number of new issues and pull requests.
sources: From 2025-01-19 to 2025-01-20, elizaos/eliza had 15 new PRs (12 merged), 6 new issues, and 33 active contributors.
From 2025-01-20 to 2025-01-21, elizaos/eliza had 31 new PRs (13 merged), 11 new issues, and 50 active contributors.
